p: It is estimated that nearly 25% of allopathic medicines have been obtained solely or synergistically from plants and many western drugs are manufactured by using them as ‘model’ production for synthetic and semi-synthetic drugs using dedicated techniques [ 11]. It is popularized that conventional or allopathic medicines can cause strong side effects if used wrongly whilst herbal or botanic medicines are considered as inexpensive, pure, easily-accessed and safer [ 12– 14].
